metadata.title: CVE-2021-4135 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A memory leak vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel's eBPF for theSimulated networking device driver in the way user uses BPF for the devicesuch that function nsim_map_alloc_elem being called. A local user could usethis flaw to get unauthorized access to some data.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
